meanings.definition: Holding or constituting a purely formal position or title without any real authority.
meanings.sent1: The titular king had no actual power in the kingdom.
meanings.sent2: The titular leader of the club was just a figurehead.
meanings.sent3: The titular mayor of the town was a cat named Whiskers.
meanings.sent4: The titular captain of the ship steered with invisible hands.
meanings.sent5: The titular professor wore a crown made of paper.

meanings.definition: Of, relating to, or constituting a title or titles.
meanings.sent1: The titular ceremony celebrated the importance of titles.
meanings.sent2: The titular page in the book listed all the chapter titles.
meanings.sent3: The titular crown sparkled with imaginary jewels.
meanings.sent4: The titular banner waved proudly above the castle.
meanings.sent5: The titular plaque displayed the names of the winners.

meanings.definition: Having the same title as the name of a work or component.
meanings.sent1: The titular song was the theme of the movie.
meanings.sent2: The titular chapter summarized the entire book.
meanings.sent3: The titular painting was a masterpiece of colors.
meanings.sent4: The titular star shone brightly in the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The titular episode left a lasting impression on the audience.
